TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {24676=All of Sebastian Vettel’s title rivals have all but given up hopes on challenging for the 2011 championship crown., 20409=With this agreement, the teams will be obliged to three tests in Jerez (Feb 7-9) and Barcelona (Feb 21-24, Mar 1-4)., 20277=Then, a new test session will take place in Mugello on May 1st, which takes place after the first 4 flyaway races of the 2012 season. This will mean that teams will be able to re-evaluate and develop their cars before the Spanish Grand Prix two weeks later., 20004=Mugello last played host to an F1 car in January 2009, when Felipe Massa unveiled the Ferrari F60.}
textBeforeTable: Driver Standings September 11, 2011 ciaranmor on Leave a comment Posted by Points standings after Italian Grand Prix HRT, Singapore GP, Vitantonio Liuzzi News Articles, Qualifying and Races Here is a video of the accident (sorry for the awful music): The stewards have concluded that the accident was avoidable, and Liuzzi will almost certainly start from the back of the grid in two weeks time. Liuzzi took to the grass (not out of necessity) on the approach to the first chicane, but on returning to the track he moved to avoid a slower car, and spun. His HRT then slammed into Nico Rosberg and Vitaly Petrov further up the field. Vitantonio Liuzzi will take a 5-place grid drop for the Singapore Grand Prix after causing carnage on the first lap in today’s Italian GP. September 11, 2011 ciaranmor on Leave a comment Posted by 5-place grid penalty for Liuzzi in Singapore
textAfterTable: Constructor Standings Team Points 1 Red Bull-Renault 451 2 McLaren-Mercedes 325 3 Ferrari 254 4 Mercedes GP 108 5 Renault 70 6 Force India-Mercedes 36 7 Sauber-Ferrari 35 8 Toro Rosso-Ferrari 29 9 Williams-Cosworth 5 10 Lotus-Cosworth 0 11 HRT-Cosworth 0 12 Virgin-Cosworth 0 Qualifying and Races Italian GP, standings Vettel dominates Italian Grand Prix Leave a comment Posted by ciaranmor on September 11, 2011 Sebastian Vettel led nearly every lap of the Italian Grand Prix, and extended his near-unbeatable points lead. Fernando Alonso took the lead at the start, but was quickly beaten by the Red Bull within a few laps.
